title: Does this sound right to you?
body: I'm not entirely sure if this is going to sound like a dumb question, but I've got level 5 Thresh, and I just played a game with him. In this game I went 2/0/14 with 45 farm as a support to Kalista. The game lasted a total of 36:44 minutes and it ended in the other team surrendering. So I was felt like it was a game deserving of an S rank or at least S- rank and was excited to start my collection of level 6 tokens, and yet as a support going 2/0/14 is only worth an A in a game where the enemy team surrendered. Does that seem right?

replies.body: You get a S based on how much gold you have per minute. Its not going to be easy
That is not something that is for supports.

The issue is that you've gotten too little in too long.

2/1/16 is a score where i got an S+, but this occurred in 23:39, so your on a timer to not only get a good score, but to end the game as well.

Because people like me can go 4/0/23 in the same time period, its matched against other people who play said champ, so if on avg people do better than you as thresh through the same time period, then you will not get an S-/S/S+.
